frameDefinitions: In this frame a Speaker ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular Topic.
An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.

Blend of Rewards_and_punishments and Bodily_injury in which the Agent performs some action intended to cause Bodily harm to the Evaluee as a consequence of some action or belief of the Evaluee (the Reason).
An Agent causes an Impactor to make sudden, forcible contact with an Impactee, or manipulates two (or more) Impactors so that they make mutual forcible contact.
frameExamples: Finally, Jan <t>shut</t> <t>up</t> about his car accident.
The judge <t>ruled</t> yesterday that the revisions were not adequate. DNI
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
The Sheriff <t>flogged</t> him for his crimes.
He <t>slammed</t> his fist down on the table and bellowed something unintelligible.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> has previously been speaking but has now stopped.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s voice or other communicative noise emitted by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the becoming silent occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the becoming silent occurs.
The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Authority</fen>'s deliberation or consideration.
This role describes the question on which the <fen>Authority</fen> gives a <fen>Finding</fen>.
The person about whom the <fen>Authority</fen> passes a judgment or <fen>Finding</fen>.
When the Authority gives his <fen>Finding</fen>.
Where the <fen>Finding</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Impactee</fen> is the entity which is hit by the <fen>Impactor</fen>.
The <fen>Impactor</fen> is the entity that hits the <fen>Impactee</fen> because of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s efforts.
The <fen>Impactors</fen> are the multiple entities that collide.
The <fen>Agent</fen>  causes an impact.

The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, 
typically non-human, force that causes an <fen>Impactor</fen> to make sudden, 
forcible contact with an Impactee.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the impact occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The children</fex> finally quieted down.
<fex>The excited chatter</fex> hushed.
<fex>The US International Trade Commission</fex> ruled that a 1987 anti-dumping tariff against frozen concentrated orange juice from Brazil could be revoked DNI.
Miss Mahmod's father ruled <fex>that she would never marry him</fex>.
US Supreme Court ruled <fex>on flag salutes in public schools</fex> today.
They held judgment <fex>upon me</fex> as a convicted traitress.
<fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
<fex>You</fex> will be flogged for your actions.
The Sheriff flogged him <fex>for his crimes</fex>.
What I want to know is who smacked <fex>my head</fex> with a 10-ton truck?
Those hoodlums strike my car <fex>with water balloons</fex> every day!
Mr. Addams likes to collide <fex>toy trains</fex> at high speed.
<fex>One juggler</fex> was hitting the ceiling with every other ball.
<fex>A violent explosion</fex>rattled the windows.
A postman rammed his Fiat Panda into a getaway car <fex>after spotting the burglars </fex> .
Father Shanahan , of Rushey Mead , Leicester , rammed his Datsun into another car <fex>on the way to the city 's Gilroes cemetery</fex>.
